Scott Kupor is a Partner and COO at Andreessen Horowitz.

Scott previously worked as Vice President and General Manager of Software-as-a-Service at Hewlett Packard. Kupor joined HP in 2007 as part of the Opsware acquisition, where he was senior vice president of Customer Solutions. In this role, he had global responsibility for all facets of customer interaction, including professional services, technical pre-sales and customer support. He provided Opsware with a mix of expertise in operations, financial management and strategic partnerships. In these roles, he led the companyâ€™s private financing activities as well as its initial public offering in 2001; he started the companyâ€™s Asia Pacific operations via strategic partnerships with NEC, NTT and Samsung; and he led the execution of the companyâ€™s acquisitions of Tangram, Rendition, Creekpath and iConclude. Prior to Opsware, Kupor represented software companies in both financing and mergers and acquisitions transactions at Credit Suisse First Boston and Lehman Brothers.

He graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Stanford University with a bachelorâ€™s degree in public policy with honors and distinction. He also holds a law degree with distinction from Stanford University and is a member of the California Bar Association.
